sami.beerbudget.logic

Class BudgetLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • sami.beerbudget.logic.BudgetLogic

  • public class BudgetLogic
extends Object
    The most important class. Does almost everything needed to use beerbudget.
    Author:
    saklindq

      • getTarget

        Returns double as the current target of the budget.
        Returns:
        the target from the budget.

      • daysToTarget

        public String daysToTarget()
        Returns string with days to accomplish the target. Counts days until target is fulfilled or 50 years is reached.
        Returns:
        string with days to the target or tells if the target will never be fulfilled.

      • iteratorBudget

        Returns budget iterator.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getCurrentDate

        public Date getCurrentDate()
        Returns Date of the current date.
        Returns:

      • currentBalance

        public double currentBalance()
        Returns the current balance as Double.
        Returns:
        Double as the current balance.

      • updateBalance

        public void updateBalance()
        Updates the balance by checking all moneyflows. Compares currentDate with the moneyflows endDate. if equals makes changes to the balance. Called every time if day changes.

      • checkIncomes

        public void checkIncomes()
        Adds to balance by checking incomes. Goes through every income, compares currentDay to incomes expirationDate and if equals, adds the amount to balance.

      • shortOfTarget

        public Double shortOfTarget()
        Tells how short of target the budget is.
        Returns:
        the shortage..

      • checkExpenses

        public void checkExpenses()
        Subracts from balance by checking expenses. Goes through every expense, compares currentDay to expenses expirationDate and if equals, subracts the amount from balance.

      • turnOneDay

        public void turnOneDay()
        Turns currentDate to next day. Updates balance.

      • turnManyDays

        public void turnManyDays(int days)
        Calls turnOneDay() many times.
        Parameters:
        days - to be turned, must be greater than 1.

      • turnToNextMonth

        public void turnToNextMonth()
        Calls turnOneDay until the month has changed. Automatically updates the balance and validates the length of current month.

      • turnToNextYear

        public void turnToNextYear()
        Calls turnOneDay until the year has changed. * Automatically updates the balance and validates the length of current month.

      • turnOneYear

        public void turnOneYear()
        Calls turnOneDay until one year has passed.

      • getIncomes

        public ArrayList<MoneyFlow> getIncomes()
        Return all Incomes in a ArrayList.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing all the incomes.

      • getExpenses

        public ArrayList<MoneyFlow> getExpenses()
        Return all Expenses in a ArrayList.
        Returns:
        ArrayList containing all the expenses.

      • sumIncomes

        public double sumIncomes()
        Return the sum of all the incomes.
        Returns:

      • sumExpenses

        public double sumExpenses()
        Return the sum of all the expenses.
        Returns:

      • newExpense

        public void newExpense(String name,
                       double amount,
                       Date expiration,
                       boolean monthly)
        Creates new expense and adds it to the budget. Asks input from the User to create a new expense.
        Parameters:
        name - String to be the name.
        amount - Double to be the amount of the MoneyFlow. Must be positive.
        expiration - Date to be the dueDate for the MoneyFlow.
        monthly - Boolean to be declare how many times to be payed.

      • newIncome

        public void newIncome(String name,
                      double amount,
                      Date expiration,
                      boolean monthly)
        Creates new income and adds it to the budget. Asks input from the User to create a new income.
        Parameters:
        name - String to be the name.
        amount - Double to be the amount of the MoneyFlow. Must be positive.
        expiration - Date to be the dueDate for the MoneyFlow.
        monthly - Boolean to be declare how many times to be payed.

      • countBeers

        public double countBeers(double price)
        Returns integer as the amount of beers User can buy at next First of May.
        Parameters:
        price - price for the wanted beer. Double.
        Returns:
        Amount of beers User can buy. Integer.

      • updateToNextMonth

        public void updateToNextMonth()
        Updates to next month. Updates balance accordingly using turnOneDay.

      • daysToGivenDate

        public int daysToGivenDate(Date dateTo)
        Returns number of days to given Date.
        Parameters:
        dateTo - Date as the target.
        Returns:
        Integer, number of days to dateTo.

      • balanceAtTheEndOfMonth

        public double balanceAtTheEndOfMonth()
        Counts and returns the amount of money User will have at the end of month. Creates a iterator Date and a copy of BudgetLogic to ensure the integrity of the real Budget.
        Returns:
        Double, amount of money User will have at the end of month.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if succeeded.
